artist: Artist: Jean Louis André Théodore Géricault; Printer: Charles Joseph Hullmandel; Publisher: Rodwell & Martin, London
catalogue_raissonne: Delteil 39 os; Beraldi 34; Rouen, Géricault Complete Prints Exh. 34 os
creditline: Gift of the Francesca S. Winston Fund, 1956
inscription: Engraved inscriptions: LL: J. Gericult del.; LC: THE ENGLISH FARRIER. / London. published by Rodwell & Martin, New Bond St. May 1821; LL: C. Hullmandel Lithography
medium: Lithograph in black with gray-green tint stone
portfolio: From Various Subjects Drawn from Life on Stone
provenance: [Henri Petiet, Paris, until 1956; sold August 1, for $350, to Mia]
text: Théodore Géricault made countless drawings, paintings, watercolors, and prints of horses. This image of a farrier at work shoeing horses belongs to a series of lithographs of everyday life. They illustrate the intimate relationship between man and beast—in which human dominance is not a given.
title: The English Farrier
